questions.question: A and B working together can complete a work in 8 days. If A alone can complete the same work in 12 days, in how many days can B alone complete the work?
questions.explanation: Using work equation: 1/8 = 1/12 + 1/x, where x is B's time. Solving gives x = 24

questions.question: If 6 workers can complete a task in 12 days, how many days will it take for 9 workers to complete the same task?
questions.explanation: Using the formula: (M1 × D1) = (M2 × D2), where M = number of workers, D = days. (6 × 12) = (9 × D2), D2 = 8

questions.question: A can do a piece of work in 10 days and B can do it in 15 days. They work together for 5 days and then A leaves. In how many days will B finish the remaining work?
questions.explanation: A and B together complete 5/6 of the work in 5 days. B alone will take 2.5 days to complete the remaining 1/6 of the work.

questions.question: If 12 men can build a wall in 20 days, how many men are needed to build the same wall in 15 days?
A can complete a task in 8 days, B in 12 days, and C in 16 days. If they work together, in how many days will they complete the task?
questions.explanation: Combined work rate = 1/8 + 1/12 + 1/16 = 13/48. Time taken = 48/13 ≈ 4.8 days

questions.question: If 5 workers can complete a project in 20 days, how many additional workers are needed to complete the same project in 10 days?
questions.explanation: Using the formula: (M1 × D1) = (M2 × D2), (5 × 20) = (M2 × 10), M2 = 10. Additional workers needed = 10 - 5 = 5

questions.question: A can do a piece of work in 6 days and B in 9 days. They work together for 3 days and then B leaves. In how many days will A finish the remaining work?
questions.explanation: A and B together complete 5/6 of the work in 3 days. A alone will take 1.5 days to complete the remaining 1/6 of the work.

questions.question: If 8 workers can complete a task in 15 days, how many days will it take for 12 workers to complete the same task?
questions.explanation: Using the formula: (M1 × D1) = (M2 × D2), (8 × 15) = (12 × D2), D2 = 10

questions.question: A can do a piece of work in 10 days, B in 15 days, and C in 20 days. If they work together for 4 days and then C leaves, in how many days will A and B finish the remaining work?
questions.explanation: A, B, and C together complete 13/15 of the work in 4 days. A and B together will take 2.5 days to complete the remaining 2/15 of the work.

questions.question: If 10 workers can complete a project in 18 days, how many workers are needed to complete the same project in 9 days?
questions.explanation: Using the formula: (M1 × D1) = (M2 × D2), (10 × 18) = (M2 × 9), M2 = 20
